bugs.title: stricter checking for bind()'s with empty passwords

bugzilla.short_desc: stricter checking for bind()'s with empty passwords

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2014-3999 php-horde-Horde-Ldap: connect to LDAP without knowing the password

long_desc.thetext:
Matthew Daley reported an issue in Horde LDAP where, if a user knew the LDAP bind user's DN, they could login without supplying a password. This has been fixed in version 2.0.6:

https://github.com/horde/horde/commit/8f719b53b0ee2d4b8a40a770430683c98fb5f2fd
https://github.com/horde/horde/commit/4c3e18f1724ab39bfef10c189a5b52036a744d55

It has been fixed in Fedora via bug 1104961, and EPEL 6 via bug 1104962.

Full details available in http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2014/q2/504

+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #1104961 +++

Description of problem:
It was reported[1] that php-horde-Horde-Ldap could be used to connect to an LDAP server with an empty password. In this case, the flaw is in the LDAP server, so this issue is just considered hardening[2].

https://github.com/horde/horde/commit/8f719b53b0ee2d4b8a40a770430683c98fb5f2fd
https://github.com/horde/horde/commit/4c3e18f1724ab39bfef10c189a5b52036a744d55

It was reported that the issue is resolved in version 2.0.6, which is already in Fedora 20 testing.

[1] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2014/06/04/22
[2] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2014/06/05/12

Most of the horde stack (including the app) is currently in epel-testing (~40 packages).

I prefer to wait a few days, to not go again for new 15 days delay, and will update Horde_Ldap as soon as possible, after push to stable.

php-horde-Horde-Ldap-2.1.0-1.el6 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 6.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/php-horde-Horde-Ldap-2.1.0-1.el6

Package php-horde-Horde-Ldap-2.1.0-1.el6:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=epel-testing php-horde-Horde-Ldap-2.1.0-1.el6'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2014-1627/php-horde-Horde-Ldap-2.1.0-1.el6
then log in and leave karma (feedback).

Package php-horde-Horde-Ldap-2.2.0-1.el6:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=epel-testing php-horde-Horde-Ldap-2.2.0-1.el6'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2014-1627/php-horde-Horde-Ldap-2.2.0-1.el6
then log in and leave karma (feedback).
php-horde-Horde-Ldap-2.2.0-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

notes:
Horde_Ldap 2.2.0
* [jan] Fix compatibility with PHP 5.3 (Bug #11888).
* [jan] Allow to specify base DN for searching user DNs.

Horde_Ldap 2.1.0
* [jan] Support multi-value RDNs in Horde_Ldap::quoteDN() (Request #11888).

Horde_Ldap 2.0.6
* [jan] SECURITY: Stricter parameter check in bind() to detect empty passwords.
